{"id":939009337,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"2Â months","timestamp":1682349477,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"1021 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/939009337/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Number of Operations to Make All Array Elements Equal to 1","memory":"42.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minOperations(int[] nums) {\n        int noOfOnes = 0;\n        for (int num : nums) {\n            if (num == 1) noOfOnes++;\n        }\n        if (noOfOnes > 0) return nums.length - noOfOnes;\n        int ans = Integer.MAX_VALUE;\n        for (int i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {\n            int gcd = nums[i]; // Take initial GCD of the [i, j] range\n            for (int j = i + 1; j < nums.length; j++) {\n                gcd = findGCD(gcd, nums[j]);  // For every new j, take gcd(nums[j], previousGCD) \n                if (gcd == 1) ans = Math.min(ans, j - i + nums.length - 1);\n            }\n        }\n        return ans == Integer.MAX_VALUE ? -1 : ans;\n    }\n\n    private int findGCD(int n1, int n2) {\n       int gcd = 1;\n\n    for (int i = 1; i <= n1 && i <= n2; ++i) {\n\n      // check if i perfectly divides both n1 and n2\n      if (n1 % i == 0 && n2 % i == 0)\n        gcd = i;\n    }\n    return gcd;\n    \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-number-of-operations-to-make-all-array-elements-equal-to-1","has_notes":false}
